description.plain:
They Might Be Giants (TMBG) are an American alternative rock band formed in 1982 in Brooklyn, New York, United States by John Flansburgh (vocals, guitar) and John Linnell (vocals, keyboards, accordion). During TMBG’s early years, Flansburgh and Linnell were frequently accompanied by a drum machine. In the early nineties, TMBG became a full band. Currently, the members of TMBG are Flansburgh, Linnell, Marty Beller, Dan Miller, and Danny Weinkauf. They are best known for an unconventional and experimental style of alternative music. Over their career, the group has found success on the modern rock and CMJ charts. More recently, they have found success in the children’s music genre, and in theme music for several television programs and films.

To date, TMBG have released 23 studio albums. Flood has been certified platinum and their children’s music album Here Come the ABCs has been certified gold. The band also won a Grammy Award in 2002 for their song “Boss of Me”, which served as the theme to Malcolm in the Middle. The band has sold over 4 million records.

body.plain:
They Might Be Giants (TMBG) are an American alternative rock band formed in 1982 in Brooklyn, New York, United States by John Flansburgh (vocals, guitar) and John Linnell (vocals, keyboards, accordion). During TMBG’s early years, Flansburgh and Linnell were frequently accompanied by a drum machine. In the early nineties, TMBG became a full band. Currently, the members of TMBG are Flansburgh, Linnell, Marty Beller, Dan Miller, and Danny Weinkauf. They are best known for an unconventional and experimental style of alternative music. Over their career, the group has found success on the modern rock and CMJ charts. More recently, they have found success in the children’s music genre, and in theme music for several television programs and films.

To date, TMBG have released 23 studio albums. Flood has been certified platinum and their children’s music album Here Come the ABCs has been certified gold. The band also won a Grammy Award in 2002 for their song “Boss of Me”, which served as the theme to Malcolm in the Middle. The band has sold over 4 million records.

songs.full_title: 200 Sbemails (For Homestar Runner) by They Might Be Giants
songs.title: 200 Sbemails (For Homestar Runner)

description.plain:
The song was originally going to be a collaboration for the 199th Sbemail (meaning Strong Bad Email, a feature for the website Homestar Runner) like They Might Be Giants previous collaboration with The Brothers Chaps, Different Town.

Eventually, time passed and Sbemail 199 eventually happened, being the Sbemail: Magic Trick but TMBG decided to record a song for the 200th sbemail instead, with The Brothers Chaps making the typically silent character, The Poopsmith, breaking his vow of silence to sing this. (Which now makes The Poopsmith the only character to not be voiced by Matt Chapman or Missy Palmer)



The song was released for free on the website as an Easter egg for the Sbemail, but was also eventually released in 2011 for They Might Be Giants' rarities album: Album Raises New and Troubling Questions.

John Linnell later provided spoken dialog for The Poopsmith in the 2016 April Fools cartoon “Marzipan’s Answering Machine #17”.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DQO1RHETKy4&t=13m15s

songs.lyrics:
6 Contributors200 Sbemails (For Homestar Runner) Lyrics[Verse]
200 sbemails
Exhausting just to think about
How can we face 200 sbemails?
The thought of all those sbemails makes me weak

description.plain: 2082 tells the story of guy who time travels into the future and smothers his future self. As he returns to his own time, he is haunted by the look in his future self’s eyes, but is consoled by the fact that he will know for sure what he was thinking when he grows old and is killed by his past self.

songs.embed_content: Read “2082” by They Might Be Giants on Genius

album.full_title: Join Us by They Might Be Giants
album.name: Join Us

body.plain: 2082 tells the story of guy who time travels into the future and smothers his future self. As he returns to his own time, he is haunted by the look in his future self’s eyes, but is consoled by the fact that he will know for sure what he was thinking when he grows old and is killed by his past self.

songs.lyrics:
10 Contributors2082 Lyrics[Verse 1]
Draw the curtain, look, you're only sleeping
Or is this only what the other you is dreaming?
Either way, hard to take
Ashen features unmistakably your own
Familiar posture, recast in skin and bone
Person from today, here is you in 2082

[Verse 2]
Remove your helmet, first equalize the pressure
No, but first, take readings to be sure
The atmosphere is safe, yes, it's safe
As the ancient one cranes his neck to look
You see his hand's been replaced with a hook
But it's clear you're very much alive, it's 2105

[Bridge]
No, it's 2240
No, it's 3415
How can you still be living?
What does this mean?

[Verse 3]
You must honor and respect the older fellow
Even as you suffocate him with his pillow
Though you're strong, he was wise
There is much you can learn from the sage
And though you'll leave and travel back to your own age
You will meet again, you two, in 2082


[Outro]
What was the look he gave intended to convey?
Was there something else he was trying to say?
It will all be revealed to you in 2082

songs.lyrics:
4 Contributors25 O’Clock LyricsThe urge to take you grows more strong
For time had made me wait too long
Each watch I smash apart
Just adding to my power
Each watch I smash apart
Just bringing near the hour
Of 25 o'clock, that's when you're going to be mine
25 o'clock, we'll be together 'til the end of time
At 25 o'clock

The ticking seconds hear them call
My spell of hours will make you fall
Each timer that I break
Will halt the flowing sands
Each timer that I break
Will put you in my hands
At 25 o'clock, that's when you're going to be mine
25 o'clock, we'll be together 'til the end of time
At 25 o'clock

Each watch I smash apart
Just adding to my power
Each watch I smash apart
Just bringing near the hour
Of 25 o'clock, that's when you're going to be mine
25 o'clock, we'll be together 'til the end of time
Of 25 o'clock, that's when you're going to be mine
25 o'clock, we'll be together 'til the end of time
'Til the end of time
'Til the end
'Til the end of time
